pr_title: TRUNK-5955 Modifiers should be declared in the correct order

timeline.bodyText: You put four spaces here, and there should be one tab. ;)
timeline.author: sacull

timeline.bodyText: There is also no tab here, in addition, there are probably two spaces between the words "final" and "Map". ;)
timeline.author: sacull

replies.bodyText:
There is also no tab here, in addition, there are probably two spaces between the words "final" and "Map". ;)

replies.bodyText: @achilep did you get a chance to look at this? https://talk.openmrs.org/t/rfc-favour-not-squashing-commits-over-squashing-commits/28482
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText:
thanks @dkayiwa  i am still finding ways of squashing commits . should I just delete this pull request and commit another one with the proper changes. i don't know if it possible to squash commits with one which has been pushed already. I am trying it out and here is my error log
Insookwa@DESKTOP-4T543HR MINGW64 ~/openmrs-core (TRUNK-5955)
$ git commit -a -m"TRUNK-5955:REMOVED THE SPACES AND REPLACED THEM WITH ONE TAB "
[TRUNK-5955 01dcf1eee9] TRUNK-5955:REMOVED THE SPACES AND REPLACED THEM WITH ONE TAB
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)

Insookwa@DESKTOP-4T543HR MINGW64 ~/openmrs-core (TRUNK-5955)
$ git status
On branch TRUNK-5955
nothing to commit, working tree clean

Insookwa@DESKTOP-4T543HR MINGW64 ~/openmrs-core (TRUNK-5955)
$ git rebase -i HEAD~2
error: cannot 'squash' without a previous commit
You can fix this with 'git rebase --edit-todo' and then run 'git rebase --continue'.
Or you can abort the rebase with 'git rebase --abort'.
replies.author: insookwa

replies.bodyText: Did you read the link that i shared?
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: Actually the link discourages squashing which I've been trying to figure out. I am very sorry   . is there a way I can fix this best @dkayiwa
replies.author: insookwa

replies.bodyText:
Here, the tab at the beginning is still missing and there are two spaces between the words "final" and "Map". ;)
If we take several adjacent lines, the lack of tabs will be better seen:
replies.author: sacull

replies.bodyText:
thanks @dkayiwa  for this information .

@achilep did you get a chance to look at this? https://talk.openmrs.org/t/rfc-favour-not-squashing-commits-over-squashing-commits/28482
replies.author: achilep

timeline.bodyText:
You've fixed the spaces at the beginning of the line nicely, but I suggest you turn on whitespace visibility in your ide.

Do you see the two dots between the words "static" and "void"? One dot is one space, and there are two. ;)
timeline.author: sacull

timeline.message:
TRUNK-5955: declared modifiers in correct order

TRUNK-5955: declared modifiers in correct order

removed extra spaces
